title: What are public schools doing that are really missing the mark in preparing students for the future? - Quora

response.answer_text: By not focusing enough on essential skills, many students will be ill prepared for their futures. What are some of the essential skills? Reading at the age appropriate level.Writing with good grammar at the age appropriate level.Developing critical thinking skills, or, “how to think”.Developing longer attention spans as students grow older.Developing self-discipline, including delayed gratification.Strong numeracy skills. Adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing with speed and accuracy for a start.Encouraging good manners and social skills.By promoting and graduating students who do not have basic skills, public schools are making a high school diploma increasingly meaningless.

The one simple thing missing is teaching students that every action has a consequence. Every action. When students leave school they face a world where this is the rule of life, but many go through school thinking “I can get away with……” and when they hit “real life” they get a shock.
